poem:
Title: "To The Innocence Lost"

Grim report in morning light,
children weaving through night's blight.
Britain's youth, unmapped 
in every draught, trapped.
Each sip turned thirteen,
a numbing sheen.
On hard truth's line, learned too soon,
echoes of laughter, hollowed under the moon.
Within this mundane world they stray,
finding solace where shadows play.
No child's play this sip, this fall,
yet into tomorrow, they crawl.
